The second premise is the negation of the consequent of the conditional statement: "It's not the case that the unicorn must have been in the forest." This can be represented as "¬U", where "¬" represents negation.

The conclusion is the negation of the antecedent of the conditional statement: "The griffin was not in the forest." This can be represented as "¬G".
